column5: This was from the Sudbury area just after the war. Different time, different mentality.
Another Sudbury photo. This was my uncle Mike who I have been compared to in regards to being hooked on fishing. I never did get a chance to fish with him. He died young.
Very cool, thanks for sharing. Love the old photos!

Old photos are the best! Such a different time, and mentality like you mentioned.  I have a musky photo of my wifes grandpa ill try to find.  All my gramps photos are with my dad.  They had huge stringers. Before the roads were built they biked to spots and had a little tinny. They hammered em on just a hook and minnow
I love vintage pics too!!  Some great photos there jimmer!  This is my dad in the early 60's on Lake Simcoe...when there was a walleye population there!   My uncle river fishing   Love the old reels!
My dad fished a Luxor just like the one on the right in the last photo all through the 50 and 60's.  the rod was also a Pezon et Michel tubular metal
I love vintage pics too!! Some great photos there jimmer!     Love the old reels!   Looks like a Mitchell 300 on LHS
I've posted this before.That's me on the dock at my uncles tourist camp on Lac Seul.50+ yrs ago
My wifes grandpa long time ago!!!   I come across this pic too and I have no idea who it is? I think it was sent to me from an OFCer with no photobucket account maybe?
Me, many many moons ago...(Eisenhower jacket)
This is one of me at Sturgeon Lake back in the 60's. The boat on the left is one my father built from scratch.

I've posted this picture a few times before but it's one of my favorites.  This is my dad fishing back in the 50's but I have no idea where it was taken.  That old baitcaster rig he's using is the rod & reel I learned to fish with and that's the boat I 1st learned how to drive.  Notice the steering wheel is on the left side of the boat and there's 2 levers for the controls, one to put the motor in gear and the other for throttle.

Here's a few... from the Archives!!    Title:  Salmon fishing, Charleston Lake Date:  ca. 1905 Place:  Charleston Lake Format:  Plate Glass Negative      Title: Fishing for suckers at the "First Dam" on the Don River Date:  ca. 190-? Place:  Toronto Format:  Black and White Print     Title:  Child ice fishing Date:  1944 Place:  Moosonee Format:  Black and white negative    Title:  Woman ice fishing, Manitoulin Island Date:  1946 Place:  Manitoulin Island Format:  Black and white negative
